description:
Global Sales Enablement and Activation is the agile team serving as an essential sales productivity function that delivers go to market strategies, just-in-time learning, sales productivity tools, assets and learning opportunities. As Customer Engineers (CE) Lead, you are an essential pillar of a highly experienced and skilled team driving field enablement and productivity for Google Cloud. You will develop and execute a strategy to enable Google Cloud Customer Engineers at a global scale to support our customers. You will validate the applicability of the materials provided by subject matter experts such as product management and product marketing to help build new content for sales skills and knowledge areas and communicate expectations before, during and after to ensure learner satisfaction with the scope and depth of what is covered. The role requires someone who is adept at working with sales, technical sales and partner team stakeholders helping them to assess their team’s enablement needs and support them with highly innovative, measurable learning and enablement programs and assets. The role requires planning, coordination, production and execution of assets and strategies to enable the sales teams.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
job_title: Customer Engineers Lead, Enablement & Activation, Google Cloud
locations: ['Sunnyvale, CA, USA', 'Seattle, WA, USA', 'Kirkland, WA, USA', 'New York, NY, USA', 'San Francisco, CA, USA']
summary:
• 6 years of experience developing sales enablement for a tech company, within a company with a large sales team, or for a public training provider.
  • 6 years of field sales/pre-sale experience.
  • Experience in program and project management.
  • Experience developing and leading Global Enablement programs and projects for a technical/pre-sales audience.

description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

Pulling on your technical and leadership expertise, you lead end-to-end research projects in multiple areas of expertise across data center facilities and manage a team of direct reports working on equipment installation, troubleshooting and debugging.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. We aim to make people's lives better through technology.
summary:
• Master's degree in Electrical/Chemical/Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in package design/integration/memory product development.
  • Experience working in cross-functional teams and external vendors on aligning/defining DOEs.
  • Experience in Assembly process development, system level downstream process interaction and packaging inspection metrology for DRAM/MCP memory products.

description:
As the Director of Service Delivery, your primary responsibility will be to manage Google’s global scaled abuse fighting operations. You will manage a team of service delivery managers and operations experts to ensure effective and efficient operations of Google’s frontline enforcement team, who perform billions of manual reviews annually that protect users from fraud and abuse on Google products. You will have global responsibility, partnering with trusted third-party vendors and internal product vertical operations experts for managing this workforce and will be responsible for ensuring fast, high-quality and on-plan delivery of product abuse-fighting commitments. In addition, you will partner with Google internal procurement, workforce and real estate management teams to design and implement site security and diversification strategies, manage vendor negotiations and contracting, design and implement workforce management systems, execute site and vendor audits, manage feedback loops from the field back into product partners and advocate for automation and tooling needs of the reviewer workforce. Importantly, you will also lead in innovating to ensure the wellness and resilience of this frontline workforce who sometimes engage with sensitive and/or disturbing content and you will be expected to partner with internal teams to develop creative and industry leading initiatives in the field of content moderation wellness.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
job_title: Director, Service Delivery, Trust and Safety Solutions
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of professional experience, including 10 years of experience working in the tech industry.
  • 5 years of experience as a global people manager addressing risk, fraud, abuse and/or trust and safety issues or in leading a scaled workforce.
  • Ability to travel internationally as required.

description:
Finance Data & Analytics (DnA) team combines business acumen, technology and innovation to organize data enable insights and create data driven and efficient Finance organization in Google. As part of this team, you will have a unique opportunity to gain perspectives on Google’s core businesses, services and the product.

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. As a Machine Learning Analyst, you will work on strategic business challenges across multiple business areas (i.e. Ads, YouTube, Search, Play, etc.) through the lens of monetization. You will collaborate with data engineers, analysts and Product Managers to create end-to-end data solutions to enable our finance partners to make informed decisions, manage risks and opportunities. You will demonstrate statistical and machine learning experience and an understanding of our business models to address complex data problems.

You are technically proficient, have the ability to clearly synthesize and communicate information, and have a can-do attitude. As part of DnA growing data science team, we are particularly excited about bringing on folks interested in advancing their data science skills and collaborating with others.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
job_title: Senior Machine Learning Analyst, Finance Data and Analytics
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in quantitative discipline or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of relevant work experience involving quantitative data analysis.
  • Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python) and database languages (e.g., SQL).

description:
Core Developer brings together different aspects of the developer experience in a single organization: Source Management, Build/Test/Release, Languages, Platforms, Frameworks, Mobile services, and Firebase.

As Director, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), you will coordinate SRE engagement needs across the organization. You will provide a single interface to engineering leadership and partner with UX and Product to ensure overall product success.

And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

  • 15 years of experience with system design, algorithms, data structures, analysis, and software design.
  • 15 years of experience managing a distributed team of engineers. Experience growing and building teams.
  • Experience conducting technical deep-dives into code.

description:
As a UX Director for Security and Privacy, you’ll partner with Product and Engineering teams to develop enterprise experiences.

In this role, you’ll help drive the future of Google Cloud’s security and identity products working with executives in Cloud UX, Product Management, and Engineering. Security is a key differentiator for Google Cloud and an area where we have the ability to leverage our technology to deliver exceptional experiences to our customers. This is a global leadership role, with a distributed team in Sunnyvale, Seattle, and Israel. As the UX Director, you’ll be an exceptional organizational lead, driving collaboration, transparency, and clarity between multiple offices, teams, and functions, while fostering a culture of user-centric design. Additionally, you’ll contribute excellent communications skills and the ability to decipher technically complex problems and articulating and leading a UX viewpoint. Lastly, you’ll bring effective product design sensibility and the ability to create simple, elegant solutions for complex, data-rich workflows.

In this role, you’ll help define and drive the future of Google design, identifying and setting product strategy, envisioning complex UX ecosystems, and inspiring teams to expand the boundaries of what’s possible. You’ll apply your passion for excellent user experiences to guide research and design processes, develop and grow team members, and enable your teams to create the best possible experiences across all of Security and Identity.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”
job_title: Director, UX, Security and Privacy, Google Cloud
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree, or PhD in Design, HCI, Interaction, and/or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in a senior role, creating strategy and designing products.
  • 5 years of experience leading teams of 10 or more.
  • Experience working with senior designers and executives in Product Management and Engineering.

description:
Product and Business Strategy Leaders bring together teams across Google’s functions to help products execute optimally. Our team pushes Google to scale at key points that refine our products and infrastructure by executing efficiently, bringing solid business sense and sound judgment, and working effectively across organizational lines.

Our roles often include components of strategy (e.g. analyzing and understanding new trends in the industry, building business plans), operations (e.g. running the cadence of organizations, connecting the operating lines between our functions), and communications. Our team partners with senior leadership to run important functions that cross-cut our existing organizations and deliver high impact projects. We help Engineers, PMs, UX, and all of our other functions to build amazing products that delight our users, and then get those products into their hands.

As business operations lead for the Payments Platform, you’ll be a key member of the leadership team working to grow, scale and run the Platform as a service to Google’s various businesses.

As Product Operations Director, you'll be at the center of decision making for the scale Payments Platform that powers the full range of Google’s businesses, both B2B and B2C. The scope of impact spans payment processing, billing and invoicing, disbursements, end user experience, forms of payment, evolving business models, underlying reporting and accounting, fraud protection, security, regulatory compliance, and more.

In this role, you will set and drive a business operations agenda to accelerate and measure progress against business and financial impact goals, risk categories, operational excellence, velocity and cross-company strategic initiatives. You will also partner closely with senior Product, Engineering, and cross-functional and cross-company leadership.
summary:
• Master's degree, MBA, or other graduate degree in Operations, Management, Technical, or Engineering field.
  • 10 years of work experience in operations, consulting, and product management in technology growth companies.
  • Experience in payments/fintech industry.

description:
The Google Cloud team helps companies seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You swiftly problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Google Cloud business and in bringing our product portfolio into companies around the world.

As a Manager of Google Cloud Technical Solutions Engineers, you'll develop team members into skilled troubleshooting experts and cross-functional leaders who not only diagnose a wide variety of G Suite problems within minutes, but also treat each problem as an input for product innovation. You'll be a part of a global team that provides 24x7 support to help customers seamlessly make the switch to Google Cloud. When customers cannot resolve issues themselves, your job is to ensure that we have the necessary tools and processes to swiftly resolve the issue with as little customer effort as possible. You'll build relationships with leaders in G Suite Software Engineering, Product Management and Site Reliability Engineering which will allow you to increase instrumentation and supportability on the platform, increase the product suite’s self help capabilities. You're expected to become a trusted source of data-supported customer feedback. You'll lead excellent operations within the team, with a focus on reliable execution. You will also lead a functional area across the global team.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
job_title: Manager, Google Cloud Technical Solutions Engineering
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in technical support engineering or similar role.
  • 1 year of experience leading a technical, customer-facing team (team lead or manager).

description:
As a Conversation Designer, you’ll leverage your knowledge of human language and communication to create seamless and natural interactions for digital systems across surfaces. You will be in a unique position to create voice-only and voice-forward experiences, partnering with internal leads to create solutions for diverse contexts like the home, mobile, auto, wearables, and more.

Successful candidates will be adept at juggling multiple projects, will feel comfortable dealing with multiple stakeholders, and will be able to think strategically while also being detailed oriented when it comes to reviewing design work and providing feedback and guidance.

Please include URLs with portfolios in addition to resume. Submissions without work samples included will not be considered.

  • Demonstrable experience designing voice and/or multi-modal applications.

description:
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

As a Trust and Safety Associate Principal in Cloud (API), your primary responsibility will be to build trust with the billions of users that sign into Google apps daily. Our team works closely with the Engineering and Product teams responsible for authorization and authentication of Google Services. We help protect Google accounts from hijackers, spammers, malware developers and more. You'll be involved with launching some of the most exciting and innovative products at Google. You'll lead a team responsible for protecting Google and its users by fighting abuse and fraud for at least one Google product. You ensure trust and reputation not only for this product but also for Google as a broader brand and company. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decisions. You have the technical know-how, charisma and ability to work with your team to make a big impact.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Technology or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of management consulting experience or 4 years of experience in operations or program management in a technical environment.
  • Experience with strategic programs that span multiple organizations.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers. Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage various Engineering-specific programs and teams.

As a Capacity Planning Lead, you'll lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects, plan requirements with internal customers, and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks, and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You'll be comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives and discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers. Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you'll manage various Engineering-specific programs and teams.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

The Google Cloud technical support team resolves customer support cases. We also work to improve the supportability of Google Cloud services so that we can solve cases faster and also have fewer cases. The challenges of improving supportability have led us to develop several tools and best practices, which we call "Supportability Engineering." See our blog post.

The goal of Supportability Engineering is to manage the total effort required from customers, support teams, and engineering teams to support products. The Supportability Tech Leads (STLs) are senior engineers who drive supportability in Google Cloud. In this role, you will be on the lookout for systemic issues that cause extra effort for customers.

You will identify solutions, which may be engineering projects, training initiatives, or documentation improvements, then you will be responsible for driving implementation across several Google Cloud teams. As stewards of the technical quality of Google Cloud support, STLs are responsible for developing the technical skills of the team and addressing the most impactful challenges in supportability engineering.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

description:
As the Director of Trust and Safety User, Content and Engagement (UCE), your primary responsibility will be to manage global teams that provide abuse protection and policy enforcement support across a range of Google’s user generated content (UGC) products. Expertise from these teams is used to prevent abuse by informing product design, driving analytical solutions, influencing consumer trust, and driving impact and operational metrics to manage current and future abuse fighting operations. In this role, you will partner with many teams across Google, including Engineering, Product and other Trust and Safety teams. While pre-existing domain expertise across all areas is not expected, you are a thought leader in your space who has the ability to work globally across a number of offices and stakeholders through effective relationship building, influencing, and communication skills. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decision making, technical know-how, charisma, and ability to lead your team to get things done for Google, our users, and partners.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

  • 15 years of experience working in the tech industry and/or a relevant research/analytical field.
  • 5 years of experience as a global people manager addressing risk, fraud, abuse, and/or trust and safety issues.
  • Ability to travel internationally as required.

description:
At Google, User Experience Researchers (UXRs) help everyone focus on the user. In this role, you will create understanding and empathy around user needs, stated and unstated, for your entire product team including designers, product managers, and engineers. You will do so by conducting primary research, exploring the behaviors and motivations of our users through methods like field visits, ethnography, surveys, usability testing, and logs analysis. Your research will help us create useful, usable, and delightful new products and features for people as well as continually innovating on our existing products. You’ll inspire change at all stages of product development by delivering compelling, written, in-person and visual presentations on your findings.

The UXR community at Google is unique. As part of our group, you will have the chance to work not only with the other UXRs on your immediate team but to work and learn from UXRs across the company through regular in-person meetups, established mentorship programs, access to our internal research tools, and 20% projects. Google is a place where UXRs can do their best work.

The Customer and Partner Experience team represents Cloud’s collective customers across various industries and global regions to ensure the broader organization is unified in resolving customer challenges. The team works with customer data (obtained via surveys, roundtables, customer gatherings, etc.) and uses it to identify and alleviate customers’ biggest challenges in working with GCP. You are a researcher to own a variety of survey and feedback tools, including touchpoint feedback gathering mechanisms and longitudinal initiatives that encompass Google Cloud products across all segments and all regions for Cloud Customer Experience.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
job_title: Survey Researcher, Google Cloud Customer and Partner Experience

• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field.
  • 4 years of relevant work experience.

description:
The overall mission of the Core Data organization is to 'Unlock the Power of Google's Data.' Our Technical Program Managers (TPMs) are critical to the organization’s ability to drive and execute on that mission.

The TPMs in Core Data define, manage and lead complex projects in the Core Data space. They plan requirements with internal customers and drive projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders.

As the TPM Director of the Core Data Project Management Organization (PMO) team, you will work closely with Engineering, Product Management and Operations within the Core Data team and across all of Core Systems, as well as often coordinating more broadly with partner product areas, including Ads, Knowledge and Cloud.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in leading teams and managing technical projects in a software engineering domain.
  • Experience working with infrastructure, data and systems.

description:
The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facilities Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some of these duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.

As a master of best-in-class practices, you develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
summary:
• 2 years of experience at the journey level in commercial or heavy industrial HVAC.
  • Ability to lift and move 50 lbs of equipment and work on platforms, ladders and under raised floors.
  • Ability to work on weekends and holidays.

description:
Google's Chrome OS lab is critical to Google - it is used for continuous testing, major automated test suites, and Chrome release qualification. We add new devices to the lab every week.

As Lab Operations Manager, you will play a key role in both ensuring high availability in the current lab, as well as planning for future labs. The position offers good growth opportunities as we continue to add more space and locations.
summary:
• 2 years of experience managing lab technicians, hardware test engineers, or contractors working in a lab set up.
  • 2 years of hands-on experience racking servers, handling devices and other lab equipment.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Design Program Manager, you will manage projects through the design process by coordinating the work of Industrial Designers, Researchers, Engineers, Operations and Manufacturing. In this role, you’ll combine expert project management skills with a passion for industrial design, color material and finishes and sustainability to help our teams design products. You’ll work cross-functionally to plan projects, define milestones, assign resources, assess risks, and help projects meet deadlines. As a Design Program Manager, you will also manage all project-related communications to team members, leaders and other stakeholders.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience managing industrial design, creative, color/material/finish or sustainability projects.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience in consumer electronics program management.

description:
We value the virtues of being hungry, humble, and people smart. We believe strongly in taking responsibility and ownership for the facilities and systems we operate and maintain. We are looking to build a high functioning team to operate and maintain Google-owned data centers in a highly cost effective, efficient, and non-traditional manner. The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facilities Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some of these duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order. You will develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You will ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly. In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
summary:
• Associate's degree, trade school certification in technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience operating/maintaining facilities (data centers, hospitals, refineries, power plants, industrial), commissioning of HVAC and mechanical distribution systems to include air and water side systems.
  • Ability to lift and move 50 lbs of equipment; work on platforms, ladders and under raised floors.

description:
As the Chrome OS, Director of Platform Technologies, you will lead and manage an Engineering organization with teams located across the globe. You will use your leadership skills to partner cross-functionally with internal teams and vendors in order to streamline processes around platform design and implementation. Your passion, technical and business depth and excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills will inspire our teams and rapidly establish trust amongst a diverse set of stakeholders and customers.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of leadership experience across engineering and partnerships in relevant domains.
  • Experience with operating systems and systems architecture.

description:
Google has one of the world's most robust and comprehensive Payments platforms. We have the features and capabilities to serve monetization needs for a vast array of product types. Google Payments platform powers monetization for Google/Alphabet products. Google Payments accepts hundreds of forms of payments in hundreds of countries around the world.

As the Director, Technical Program Management, Payments Platform for Google Payments, you will lead a team of Technical Program Managers who define new programs, drive launches, improve productivity, and work cross-functionally within the Payments Platform. You will operate as a close partner to the Payments leaders and will be jointly accountable for the success of Payments platform, which services both internal and external clients.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
job_title: Director, Technical Program Management, Payments Platform, Google Payments
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in managing technical projects in a software engineering domain.
  • People management experience.

description:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and working across discipline lines, then our team might be your next career step.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. We aim to make people's lives better through technology.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in the following tools such as place and route tools, PrimeTime, Calibre.
  • Experience with CMOS digital logic function, timing, and power.

description:
As Commercial Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
summary:
• JD degree or equivalent degree.
  • 7 years of relevant attorney work experience.
  • Admitted to the bar and in good standing or otherwise authorized to practice law (e.g., have registered in-house status) in the state in which the position is located.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud.

  • 7 years of relevant attorney level work experience.
  • Admitted to the bar and in good standing or otherwise authorized to practice law (e.g., have registered in-house status) in the state in which the position is located.

description:
As Director, Network Operation, you will use your broad and deep background in telecommunications and IP operations to lead a global distributed team of engineers who maintain Google’s physical network infrastructure. The challenge is to anticipate and meet operational requirements, while ensuring the smooth running of quality infrastructure and systems supporting the needs of our internal and external customers. The need for quick change and versatility means that job responsibilities cover a full range of tasks from process development through operational implementation and maintenance and business partner support.

You have a passion for building high performing teams and driving scalable processes and standards into a global, distributed operation. You have a bias toward action, while also recognizing the value of careful planning in a production environment. You are a charismatic leader who takes pride in helping others succeed and are equally adept at leading teams and influencing groups not directly under your supervision. You will work closely with leaders and engineers across global network infrastructure, network engineering, network planning, site reliability engineering, and software engineering to provide a seamless and reliable operation of Google’s network that benefits both internal and external customers.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
summary:
• Experience in the networking/telecommunications field and 10 years of relevant operations leadership experience.
  • Technical experience with telecommunication networks, including IP and optical.
  • Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.

description:
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure organization to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Global Capacity Delivery (GCD) delivers capacity at extraordinary speed, scale, and efficiency. We plan, introduce new products, source, build, deliver, and return. We are responsible for Supply Chain Planning, Global Commodity Management, Global Manufacturing, New Product Introduction, Product Lifecycle Management, Global Logistics, Program Management, Supply Chain Responsibility, and Supply Chain BizOps.

We plan, buy, build, and deploy a large cloud infrastructure. We enable our cloud infrastructure to operate in the most resource efficient manner - economically and technically. We will provide a sustainable sustainable and socially responsible cloud infrastructure.

As the Americas Logistics Operations Director, you will be responsible for logistics activities across Americas operations including leadership and operational excellence for warehousing, machine installation, machine decommissioning, reverse logistics, and spares execution, while also supporting warehouse automation, and driving excellence with our extensive and complex 3PL network in the Americas. You will partner closely with the TI/GCD organization to provide warehousing, trade compliance, and transportation activities that support the build out of Google’s global compute capacity for Alphabet.

The Business Operations and Strategy team at Google plays a critical role in defining and driving strategic, operational and organizational improvements across the company. Also known as "BizOps", the group operates like an internal consulting group working on a range of critical projects and issues. BizOps creates strategies for promoting growth of our products like YouTube, Chrome and Mobile. They handle issues around partner development, strategy work in emerging markets such as Africa and India, as well as pricing strategies across our B2B and consumer products. The BizOps team is at the forefront of Google's fast-moving strategic priorities, addressing operational challenges and enabling innovation.
job_title: Director, Americas Logistics Operations, Google Cloud
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Supply Chain operations, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of Warehouse or Fulfillment Operations Management experience, including 3PL supplier management, warehouse/fulfillment management, warehouse automation, and MRP systems. Experience managing remote teams, suppliers, or projects.
  • Experience leading safety, security, quality, inventory programs in warehouses

description:
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

Global Product Policy, part of Google's Trust and Safety team, develops policies that help improve user experiences across a wide variety of Google's products.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of relevant work experience.

description:
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Policy team's mission is to promote a positive experience for users, advertisers, partners and Googlers. You will help work toward this goal by developing, launching and implementing fair and consistent policies that protect the online safety of our users. You will collaborate with a wide-range of stakeholders, from engineers to sales managers to attorneys, working with them to reach consensus on policy issues. You will develop content policies, support training and deal with escalations that arise in relation to policies after launch. You will build expertise in providing greater transparency in all advertising; particularly in political and elections advertising so as to help prevent foreign interference, and to give users information about the ads they see across our platforms.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of relevant work experience
  • Experience in Internet and/or Content policy development.

description:
Product and Business Strategy Leaders bring together teams across Google’s functions to help products execute optimally. Our team pushes Google to scale at key points that refine our products and infrastructure by executing efficiently, bringing solid business sense and sound judgment, and working effectively across organizational lines.

Our roles often include components of strategy (e.g. analyzing and understanding new trends in the industry, building business plans), operations (e.g. running the cadence of organizations, connecting the operating lines between our functions), and communications. Our team partners with senior leadership to run important functions that cross-cut our existing organizations and deliver high impact projects. We help Engineers, PMs, UX, and all of our other functions to build amazing products that delight our users, and then get those products into their hands.

Google Cloud Platform is one of the fastest growing businesses within Google. We deliver innovative solutions, leveraging our experience in building secure, reliable, and scalable cloud technology.

The Cloud Services Platform - Product Strategy and Business Operations team is looking to hire a Principal/Lead. You will work closely with the product management, engineering, and other cross-functional teams (e.g., Sales, Marketing, Partner) to develop business-level and product strategies (e.g., multi-year business plan, specific product strategies, new product business cases, Go-to-Market strategy), drive ad-hoc strategic projects (e.g., partner models, M&A business cases), incubate new initiatives, provide analytics support (e.g., define key business metrics, perform in-depth analysis to answer important questions on product trends/business performance), and facilitate running the business (e.g. orchestrate business reviews).

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in Management Consulting, Corporate Development, Product Management, Engineering, Operations, and/or Finance/Investment Banking/Venture Capital.
  • Product/technical experience working for or with enterprise tech companies and/or cloud service providers.

description:
In this multifaceted role, you will build consumer products that billions of users around the world interact with and that drive measurable and tangible business outcomes for Google. You will help us ensure that the Android ecosystem stays healthy and competitive, with happy users, and successful, engaged developers.

Google Play is the discovery platform for Android, it delivers digital experiences for (i.e., games, apps, subscriptions, books, and movies). Our Growth and Points Product team builds the products that enable Play to communicate and strengthen relationships with our users around the world. This includes products such as our our Growth Platform, the platform that sends all promotional and informational messages for Play, and Play Points a loyalty program that is driving deeper and more engaging relationships with our users.

summary:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in full-lifecycle of product management (i.e., product vision and roadmaps, writing PRDs, shipping products).
  • Experience leading product efforts and setting strategic direction/roadmaps in complex, multi-stakeholder, and/or B2B/B2C spaces.
  • Experience growing and leading Product Management team.

description:
Technology never stops evolving. Part of the engEDU educational team, Instructional Designers know what our engineers need to know and how to teach it. Using human learning principles, you develop Google's training programs by assessing Googler needs, designing curriculum and coordinating rollout to stakeholders all over the world. You evaluate training opportunities, participant satisfaction and program stability to make sure that Google's technical development programs are teaching skills that are truly valuable while reaching as many Googlers as possible. From face-to-face instruction to collaborative webinars, training programs can take any form and need to translate for Googlers of all backgrounds, levels and regions.

“My internet is too fast!”... said no one, ever. Google Fiber’s mission is to deliver abundant, reliable internet on networks that are always fast and open. On our team, you’ll work in a fast-paced environment that’s challenging the status quo in the broadband industry.

As an Instructional Designer, you'll take ownership of the design and production of education materials to ensure quality deliverables. You'll participate in the entire instructional life-cycle including designing, developing, testing, and measuring the effectiveness of training programs and track record of delivery on objectives and impact at scale. You will consult with Program Managers on appropriate learning solutions, conduct needs analysis and develop all support and evaluation plans. You will create learning solutions for multiple delivery methods including instructor-led, hands-on lab sessions, web-based, and blended instruction. Finally, you'll perform ongoing analysis of training programs and performance trends to ensure objectives remain at the front of the field.
summary:
• Bachelor's Degree in Instructional Design, Graphic Design, E-Learning, media asset production or equivalent practical experience.
  • Adobe Creative Suite experience using Photoshop or Illustrator.
  • Technical Writing experience.
  • Experience using marketing channels and tools for visual and verbal communication to target specific markets.

description:
Continuing to build and expand the Google network is a daily operational task that spans the globe. Our network planning and delivery software team supports this constant growth by building software that forecasts our future business needs for network combining organic and inorganic signals, solves optimization and simulation problems to translate needs into a reliable and scalable topology, and pre-describes the physical build down to the chassis, line-cards, and optics to be ordered and connected. Additionally, we manage significant physical inventory and processes for validating and activating new capacity.

As the Director, Network Planning and Delivery Software, you will be a hands-on leader contributing experience in large-scale distributed systems development and networking. You will collaborate with stakeholders from across the business to work towards our vision of an end-to-end automated capacity delivery process, which significantly reduces the cycle-time to build new network capacity. You will also manage a team of software engineers and program managers and will be expected to grow the team and its capability to execute through recruiting and mentoring the team. Finally, you will oversee our near- and medium-term roadmap to achieve the business goals and intervene proactively day-to-day where issues prevent its execution.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
job_title: Director, Network Planning and Delivery Software, Google Cloud
summary:
• Experience managing a 50+ person Engineering Organization.
  • 5 years of experience building large-scale software systems including design, implementation, testing, and operations.
  • Experience with IP Networking including Layer 1-3.

description: Finance Data & Analytics (DnA) team combines business acumen, technology and innovation to organize data enable insights and create data driven and efficient Finance organization in Google. As part of this team, you will have a unique opportunity to gain perspectives on Google’s core businesses, services and the products. At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. As a Senior Machine Learning Analyst, you will work on strategic business challenges across multiple business areas (ex. Ads, YouTube, Search, Play, etc.) through the lens of monetization. You will collaborate with data engineers, analysts and PMs to create end-to-end data solutions to enable our finance partners to make informed decisions, manage risks and opportunities. You will demonstrate statistical & machine learning experience and an understanding of our business models to tackle complex data problems.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in quantitative discipline or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of relevant work experience involving quantitative data analysis
  • Industry experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python) and database languages (e.g., SQL)

description:
The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facilities Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some of these duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.

As an advocate for best practices, you develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly. In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
summary:
• Associate's degree, trade school certification or other verifiable training in a relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years at journeyman or technician level.
  • Ability to lift and move 50 lbs of equipment, work on platforms, ladders and under raised floors.
  • Ability to work non-standard hours, including weekends, holidays and on shift-based schedules.

  • 2 years of experience at Apprenticeship/Technician-level in Mechanical/Heating, HVAC and/or Electrical Engineering.
  • Ability to lift and move 50 lbs of equipment; work on platforms, ladders and under raised floors.
  • Ability to work non-standard hours and differing work rotations/shifts.
