description:
Our team brings Google scale to key Google and Alphabet investments in M&A and business ventures. We refine our strategic “Bets” and infrastructure by executing efficiently, bringing business sense and sound judgment and working effectively across organizational lines to integrate and build the future of Google. Our roles often include components of strategy (e.g. analyzing and understanding the new businesses Google is investing in), operations (e.g. running the cadence of integrations,, connecting the operating lines between our functions), and communications. Our team partners with senior executives to run important functions that cross-cut our existing organizations and deliver high impact projects. We help Engineers, PMs, UX, and all of our other functions integrate amazing products that delight our users, and then get those products into their hands.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience implementing and integrating with third-party software through full system implementation life-cycles (i.e., analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
  • Experience working with one or more general purpose programming languages (including Java, JavaScript or Python, C, C++, ABAP).

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

Through your leadership, you use your technical expertise and manage a team of engineers to build key business applications. You gather requirements, lead technical projects, define the scope of those projects and partner across teams to address technical problems and ensure smooth solution implementation.

As an Application Engineering Manager, you'll help drive projects to improve finance processes that the company manages through the business applications it builds and uses. You are an experienced manager. You have the ability and interest to work on a range of different types of projects and business processes, and have a background that demonstrates this ability.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience managing Information Technology teams.

description:
As a Policy Specialist, you will be working with the Trademark and Counterfeit Operations team, which fields trademark and counterfeit complaints related to a variety of Google products, including (but not limited to) Google Ads, Google Shopping, and Google Play. You will review and process these complaints, with a high degree of accuracy and efficiency. In this role, you will be comfortable working independently. You will review trademark registrations and conduct an analysis/investigation of trademark descriptiveness, use, and ownership. You will also respond to internal and external inquiries regarding the trademark/counterfeit policies and processes. Individuals applying for this position will not be eligible for immigration sponsorship.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 months of policy, operations, legal or communications work experience.
  • Ability to speak and write in English and Russian or Ukrainian fluently and idiomatically.

description:
Google Cloud is widely recognized as a global leader in delivering a secure, open, and intelligent enterprise cloud platform. Today, customers across more than 150 countries trust Google Cloud to modernize their computing environment for today’s digital world. We are helping thousands of organizations, including many of the world’s largest companies, transform their businesses.

As the Director of Engineering, Sales Systems, for Google Cloud, you will be responsible for defining the roadmap and executing the delivery of systems and business applications supporting the sales teams at Google Cloud. You will oversee a multi-functional team comprised of software engineers, business system analysts, project managers, and quality assurance professionals. This role requires a diverse set of skills and experiences, ranging from expertise in industry best practices for sales, to a strong software engineering and product development background, to the ability to work within a cross-functional environment. You have a passion for identifying technical solutions for business problems and a track record in delivering innovative systems, rooted in user experience research and engineering excellence.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
job_title: Director of Engineering, Sales Systems, Google Cloud
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in software development leadership.
  • 8 years of experience in sales systems, either in product development or in IT operations.

description:
On the Google Technical Services Velocity team, we aim to make mobile web faster and more engaging for millions of users through close partnerships with Google’s customers, and more scaled engagements with all other segments of customers. We also help bring Google Assistant to non-Google devices and services. These initiatives are critical for Google’s future growth, and require high-velocity decision-making with many teams across Google.

As a Partner Technology Manager, you will be the interface between the Assistant Partner Engineers, who are responsible for our largest partner relationships, and other stakeholders, such as Product Management, Engineering, and Sales. You will lead cross-functional teams consisting of these stakeholders, and you will work closely with partners to leverage emerging technologies.

From design and conceptualization through to early piloting and wide-scale deployment, you will oversee the technical execution and business operations of Google distribution partnerships for one or more areas. You will work on developing product and technical strategy as well as prioritize projects and resources that assist our account management team and partners.

Working in a fast-changing product environment, you're able to balance business and partner needs with technical constraints. Entrepreneurial and detail-oriented, you are motivated by bringing Google products and technologies to market and to our partners.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
summary:
• BS degree in Computer science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of writing and managing system and technical requirements.
  • Experience driving consensus across stakeholders with diverging interests.

description:
Within Geo, the Small Businesses team builds products that span local shopping and services verticals. We do this by designing for both the consumer and trusted businesses -- connecting them in useful ways to help users get things done.

To accomplish this, we build merchant-facing experiences such as Google My Business where Small Businesses can share more with the world of who they are, what they sell, and respond to user reviews or questions. We also build consumer-facing experiences on Search and Maps where users can message with small businesses, book appointments, see their products, or request quotes.

In this role, you will play a critical strategic and leadership role in defining and developing end-to-end experiences and innovations for the consumer to small business marketplace. As the UX Lead for Small Businesses, you will serve as a member of a cross-functional leadership team as well as be expected to work effectively and in collaboration with your peers across Google in the Ads and Search organizations.

As a UX leader, you will envision, define, and drive the future of Google design through the work you lead. You identify and set product strategy, envision complex UX ecosystems, and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible for compelling user experiences that deliver true user value. You are a compassionate and effective leader and manager of teams, and you drive executional excellence through your high-performing team.

The Geo product area within Google is the home of Google Maps, Google Earth, Google My Business, Local Search, and the Maps API business. The mission of the Geo Product Area is to “assist people everywhere as they navigate, explore, and get things done in the world.” With over a billion happy users worldwide, we have a great opportunity to stand on our own shoulders.
job_title: Director of UX, Geo, Small Businesses
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Design, HCI, Interaction or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in a C-level role, creating strategy and product design in a two-sided marketplace.
  • Outstanding UX portfolio, demonstrating clear insights, problem solving, and simple solutions.
  • Experience with front-end mobile and web technologies.

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Sales Engineering Manager, you will help our client make their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative with our products. You'll assist fellow Sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. Additionally, you will liaise with the Product Marketing Management and Engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.

As a Customer Engineering Manager for Financial Services, you will serve as an executive leading a team to understand and assess customer requirements, prepare and present demonstrations of Google’s Cloud technologies, and address and overcome technical objections. You'll lead efforts to drive solution innovation, working across the organization to identify the right assets and tools to drive customer adoption. Additionally, you'll leverage the Google Cloud Platform to bring legacy financial systems into the Cloud, allowing better insights into customer needs and growth opportunities within financial markets.

In this role, you'll develop new relationships with business unit leaders to more deeply understand their challenges, demonstrating deep industry understanding and communicating the business value of “One Google”. You will wield the innovative power of our products and solutions to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers & developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
job_title: Sales Engineering Manager, Financial Services, Google Cloud
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in quota carrying software sales and strategic account management at enterprise B2B software companies, engaging with accounts, and selling cloud products.
  • Experience in the Financial Services industry.
  • Experience managing teams.

description:
We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward.

As the Principal Architect for Graphics Processing Unit (GPU), you will be responsible for driving the top level strategy for Google's GPU architecture across the entire company.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. We aim to make people's lives better through technology.
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of technical experience in the Graphics Processing Unit field.

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Strategic Business Executive, you'll manage our top public sector accounts, leveraging existing relationships with C-level executives, developing new relationships, and acting as a business partner to understand our customer's challenges and goals. You will lead the innovative power of our products to make agencies, academic institutions, and government entities more productive, collaborative, and mobile, using your passion for Google products to help spread the magic of Google to organizations around the world.

  • 10 years of experience in software sales and strategic account management at a B2B software company.

description:
As a Litigation Paralegal, you'll work alongside in-house Counsel, outside Counsel, and Discovery team members to research legal claims made against Google in a variety of matters. The types of matters may include breach of contract, trademark infringement, copyright infringement, patent infringement, class actions, privacy-related matters, and regulatory inquiries and internal investigations. You will also contribute to projects related to tool development and process improvements to increase operational efficiencies.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of litigation support experience as a Paralegal or Legal Specialist at a law firm or in-house legal department.

description:
As the Director of Product Management for the Chrome OS Platform, you will oversee product management efforts with critical scope and impact for one of the leading operating systems in the world. This is a multi-faceted role that includes product strategy, leadership, and business challenges.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
job_title: Director, Product Management, Chrome OS Platform
summary:
• 10 years of experience within leadership.
  • Experience with building and evolving distributed teams.
  • Experience with building and cultivating executive relationships with OEM/ODMpartners.
  • Experience with recruiting and developing talent.

description:
As a Senior Director within the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team you’ll manage the production infrastructure for our application modernization platform and Developer family of products: GKE, Istio, Anthos, Serverless (App Engine, Cloud Run), Cloud Build, Monitoring and Logging, as well as the API, Billing and Console infrastructure for all of Cloud, and the Customer Reliability Engineering (CRE) team. You will apply engineering leadership and deep knowledge of infrastructure and software development at scale to lead the operation and evolution of these services. You will also lead Google Cloud’s ability to provide organizations with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions, and expertise for digital transformation and inspire and lead a global team to keep services running efficiently, and reliably, while maximizing feature velocity.

Application modernization is a rapidly-growing area, and is a differentiator for the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). As customers migrate to the Cloud, they are typically looking for higher levels of abstraction and to delegate service management to their Cloud provider. As such, we expect this area to continue its growth over the next few years. CRE provides a unique opportunity to influence the industry's approach to reliable, large-scale services, while influencing GCP engineering with the distinctive voice of the customer.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in system design, algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis, and software design and/or experience in Unix/Linux systems, IP networking, performance, and application issues.
  • 10 years of experience managing teams of software engineers.

description:
gTech’s Professional Services team takes a creative, collaborative, and customer-centric approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to top advertiser and publisher customers. Through technical implementation, optimization, and key solutions, gTech Professional Services helps customers attain their business goals while building long-term capabilities.

The Global Client and Agency Solutions Customer Solutions Engineering team is responsible for developing innovative, cutting-edge solutions to the business problems faced by advertisers. Your solutions will take many forms, from prototypes and demos to education - all with the technology resources of Google to back it up.

In this role, you'll be responsible for identifying and prioritizing your own projects. You will see the unique business challenges faced by our largest advertisers, and you will be given the opportunity to develop solutions no one else has. Working across the entire organization, you will have the chance to leverage your wide-ranging experience and skill-set to find the best solution for the problems at hand.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience with systems design and/or coding in a general purpose programming language (e.g. Java, C/C++, Python).
  • Experience working with web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript and HTTP.
  • Customer-facing experience translating technical concepts and solutions to non-technical and executive audiences.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
summary:
• BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience coding with a programming language (Java, C/C++, Python).
  • Experience working with web technologies including, but not limited to: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and HTTP.
  • Customer-facing experience translating technical concepts and solutions to non-technical and executive audiences.

description:
The Customer Solutions Engineering team is responsible for developing innovative, cutting-edge solutions to the business problems faced by the world’s largest advertisers. Your solutions will take many forms, from prototypes and demos to education - all with the technology resources of Google to back it up.

You will be responsible for identifying and prioritizing your own projects. You will see the unique business challenges faced by our largest advertisers, and you will be given the opportunity to develop solutions no one else has. Working across the entire organization, you will have the chance to leverage your wide-ranging experience and skill-set to find the best solution for the problems at hand.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
summary:
• BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience coding with a general purpose programming language (ie. Java, C/C++, Python).
  • Experience working with web technologies including, but not limited to: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and HTTP.
  • Customer-facing experience translating technical concepts and solutions to non-technical and executive audiences.

description:
As a Technical Director within the CTO Office (OCTO), you will establish deep relationships with technical executives from the largest worldwide commercial and government organizations, both at a national and a state/local level. You will provide leadership advice which includes people, process and technical recommendations to technical and non-technical leaders in government organizations. Overall, you will represent the technical voice of Google Cloud in the commercial and public sector markets. Success is achieved when government executives list you as the most important relationship they have with Google.

Your days may include whiteboarding sessions with a CIO/CTO, evangelism for emerging technology as a keynote presenter, deep dives with internal engineering teams on the key use cases for a launch, and/or leading a cross-Google technical team through a critical engagement with a CIO. You will be at home on stage, in the meeting room, or in private consultation as a trusted adviser, and possess stellar communication skills, patience and a commitment to follow through that inspires confidence.

You are a recognized expert in cloud computing, analytics and/or machine learning, with significant enterprise experience in one or more industries (e.g. Public Sector, Healthcare, Retail, Financial Services, Tech, Manufacturing). You’ve been a CTO, SVP of Engineering or equivalent technical leader that has delivered significant business outcomes through cloud related innovation.

You probably started as a software and/or infrastructure engineer and, although you've become a people manager and/or independent advisor, you seek to stay close to technology while maintaining/increasing your level of customer interaction. You love solving technical edge cases that enable people and organizations to achieve significant breakthroughs, staying current on cloud computing technology such as compute, storage, network, analytics, machine learning, mobile, containers, application dev/test/deployment, security. You thrive in executing through influence and have a willingness to roll up your sleeves to get work done.

Your knowledge of Google's infrastructure and Cloud Platform should surpass our customers'. You are also constantly researching non-GCP and non-Google cloud related products/platforms/solutions.
job_title: Technical Director, Office of the CTO, Public Sector, Google Cloud
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of professional experience in software engineering with a demonstrated track record of technical innovation and leading successful engineering teams.
  • 2 years of experience working in the government space.
  • Ability to travel as required.

description:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

As a Regulatory Investigations Counsel, you will work on a team dedicated to overseeing complex internal investigations and regulatory inquiries involving Google products and businesses around the world. You’ll partner with various cross-functional teams involved in conducting investigations, including by developing best practices for conducting investigations, training, tracking and monitoring regulatory inquiries and investigations, and responding to matters involving heightened risk.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
summary:
• JD or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years broad-based experience with regulatory and corporate investigations, including strategically addressing, minimizing and avoiding regulatory risk.
  • 6 years of experience conducting congressional investigations

description:
Our Legal team needs more than attorneys to keep things moving. Our Legal Operations team is charged with improving and maintaining the Legal team's internal processes, systems and tools. Responsible for tracking objectives, coordinating financial planning and solving technology challenges, you are entrepreneurial, proactive and highly organized. You keep costs down, engage third-party vendors and make the Legal team's services better, faster and more efficient.

As a Discovery Staff Attorney, you will respond to a variety of litigation matters and understand the law and the discovery process. You will collaborate with Google Counsel on discovery issues and processes and work with the Discovery & Litigation Support team, other Google attorneys and outside counsel on substantive planning for all phases of discovery review projects, including analytic assessment of Google data, privilege analysis and review, coordinating with support vendors and managing attorney document and privilege reviews and production of data. Additionally, you will be involved in the development of processes associated with these responsibilities and the various teams involved in projects.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
summary:
• Juris Doctorate or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in discovery with electronic discovery, document review management and multiple electronic discovery platforms.
  • Experience working on document review projects in a project management/team lead capacity.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Google Data Centers (GDC) make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures on the planet. As a Continual Improvement Program Manager, you will lead core initiatives to reduce inefficiencies in design and construction by implementing key strategies to improve Cost of Poor Quality (CoPQ). You will work with technical stakeholders to ensure a rigorous continuous improvement process is in place to measure and improve design quality through effective tools and process requirements. The Design Quality Program manager will drive systemic process improvement actions to reduce CoPQ.

As a Continual Improvement Program Manager, you will drive product and workmanship quality requirements, designs, specifications, suppliers, production lines, quality assurance/control strategies, commissioning, integrators, logistics, assembly and operations to assure on-time delivery of our power, cooling and infrastructure control systems. Your team will work cross-functionally with R&D, Platforms, Hardware Operations, Procurement and Product Introduction, Data Center (DC) Design, Engineering, Program Controls, and Operations, to deliver more efficient and greener capacity globally with increasing predictability, low cost of poor quality and shorter lead times.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
job_title: Continual Improvement Program Manager, Global Data Center
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Business Process Management, Operations, Civil/Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial/Process Engineering, or other technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of work experience working with structural, electrical, mechanical and controls equipment.
  • Experience collaborating and influencing across multiple levels of an organization, and leading cross-functional process improvements.

description:
Trust and Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

As an operations manager, you will be responsible for driving operational rigor for global abuse fighting and making Trust and Safety's vendor operations outstanding. You will work in partnership with product functions in the US region to understand their needs and help identify the best vendor strategy to deliver them. You will partner seamlessly with vendor operations teams across locations to drive excellence throughout our vendor operations. You will focus on scalable solutions and operational execution. You are a tactical leader who possesses the ability to think strategically and work globally and cross-functionally with several internal stakeholders through effective relationship building, influence and communication. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decisions. You have the technical know-how, charisma and ability to work with your team to make a big impact.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
job_title: Operations Manager, Trust and Safety Service Delivery
summary:
• Bachelor's Degree in a technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of successful Operations or Project management experience.
  • Experience with data analysis and problem solving.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

As an Application Engineering Manager, you'll help us build innovative solutions to scale our Google Fiber business. Our team focuses on building systems to optimize the results throughout the lifecycle of network and customers. In addition to network and service management, the functional areas also include Marketing, Sales, Network Design, Construction, Deployment, Customer Support, Dispatch, and other business and network operational functions.

In this role, you'll lead a team of 5 to 8 engineers to work with other Engineering and Business teams to integrate and support as needed. You'll execute well in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment and be passionate to support systems used by our users, from internal business users to external customers, business partners, contractors, and vendors.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience implementing/integrating third-party software through full-system implementation life-cycles (analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
  • 3 years of experience in technical leadership/people management.
  • Experience programming in one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., Java, C++, JavaScript, Python).

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

Our team of engineers, product managers, and sales and marketing professionals work with a vast array of partners and customers to advance the company's mission to organize the world's information to make it universally accessible and useful.

As a Big Query, Data Analytics Sales Specialist, you will be a solution sales executive, aligned to our Telco, Media and Entertainment direct enterprise sales organization, and working closely with our largest customers to help them shape their cloud strategy and enable their digital transformation. You will serve as an expert for our clients, helping to communicate the value proposition of Google Cloud’s data analytics capabilities.

You have deep knowledge of Big Data and are well-versed in the strategies required to help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud and navigate the acquisition processes.

As a member of the Google Cloud team, your focus is on customers that want to leverage BiqQuery and GCP’s You advocate for the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
job_title: BigQuery, Data Analytics Sales Specialist, Google Cloud

description:
Behind every great Google product is Google Support. Our mission in Support Platform is to understand Google's customers' issues and provide effective, efficient, excellent resolutions. Google Support touches millions of Google customers through in-product self help and multi-channel high-touch support.

We're looking for a UX Leader who can establish an amazing vision and drive working definition to ensure that Support Platform remains and continues to grow as an undisputed core strength across Google’s products and services. Your charter will include working with product partners across Google to set a vision, staffing your team with additional firepower and working with your Product Management and Engineering partners to operationalize your vision into reality. This role will have a massive impact on Google and its users.

In this role, you’ll be part of the leadership organization driving Customer Engagement User Experience (CEUX), a team with fun culture and strong shared values. CEUX owns charter for customer support, sales customer lifecycle for Google Ads and a suite of amazingly powerful internal development applications which empower teams to build software and processes across Google.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”
job_title: Director of UX, Google Support Platform
summary:
• 10 years of experience growing design teams.
  • Experience providing consumer-grade experiences powered by multiple underlying enterprise-grade services.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

Google Lens lets users search what they see. Powered by Google's deep expertise in computer vision and machine learning, we're working on creating compelling experiences for our users across products like Google Search, Google Assistant, and Google Photos.

We’re looking for a senior Product Management leader to drive our product strategy and capabilities for Lens Shopping, a critical part of Lens. The role is responsible for leading all our efforts around Shopping in Lens, spanning foundational recognition and results quality through the building of useful and delightful user experiences.

As a relatively early stage product, you’ll have a key role in defining the overall roadmap of Lens, in partnership with many teams across Google. You’ll have the opportunity to work with leading-edge immersive computing and AR tech.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in product management.
  • Experience developing products, go-to-market plans, and scaling consumer-facing product(s). Experience driving results in cross-functional, cross-team environments.
  • Experience looking at data/metrics to inform complex decisions.

description:
At Google, Product Management Leaders work closely with our engineers and salespeople to guide products from conception to launch. As part of the Product Management team, you’ll bridge the technical and business worlds as you design services that our users and advertising partners love. With a focus on improving our ability to measure media impact, projects will involve working closely with partners in other parts of Google (YouTube, Search, Play, Maps, and more) to developing the latest privacy and measurement techniques.

The Ads team is seeking an experienced executive to lead Product Management within the Analytics, Insights and Measurement (AIM) organization. As a Product Management Director, you will be part of a new team with the scope to have massive impact on the advertising ecosystem. In this highly impactful role, you will help build multi-billion dollar businesses and shape relevant industries.

As Product Management Director, you will be responsible for leading strategy and execution in your product area while building and leading a highly talented team of product managers.

Users come first at Google. Nowhere is this more important than on our Advertising and Commerce team: we believe that ads and commercial information can be highly useful to our users if that information is relevant to what our users wish to find or do. Advertisers worldwide use Google Ads to promote their products; publishers use AdSense to serve relevant ads on their website; and business around the world use our products (like Google Shopping, and Google Wallet) to support their online businesses and bring users into their offline stores. We are constantly innovating to deliver the most effective advertising and commerce opportunities of tomorrow.
job_title: Director of Product Management, Analytics, Insights and Measurement
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, a related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of product management or related experience that spans business and consumer users.
  • Experience leading, mentoring and managing/developing a team of product managers.

description:
Our buildings are the physical embodiment of our culture and inspire our employees to deliver equally ambitious products and services. As a District Design Lead in our Real Estate Development organization, you will be on the front lines of Google's physical expansion, working to design workplaces, buildings, and campuses that shape the Google of tomorrow. You'll work directly with the District Director and the Development Executives for the district and specific Google office campus and workplace projects, helping to define and articulate our vision for the design of the built environment.

In this role, you'll communicate Google’s vision to a wide range of audiences, providing leadership to the teams who bring our buildings to life. You have the ability to envision a future that will challenge the idea of traditional architecture, design, and construction practices. You will ensure that projects are not only built to Google's industry-leading standards, but also achieve aspirational environmental goals.

The Real Estate Development team is focused on creating inspiring mixed-use neighborhoods, anchored by a Google campus. Our developments are designed to enable Google, our employees and our communities to thrive together. We believe successful place is at the intersection of Community, Nature, Innovation and Economics. As an in-house development group, our team is focused on all aspects of the development process, from land assemblage and entitlements to the full design and delivery of these mixed-use communities.
summary:

  • 10 years of experience in planning, design development, or project management on projects from initiation through execution.

Technical writers communicate complex information clearly, concisely and accurately, and without relying on jargon. As a technical writer, your role involves tasks such as writing conceptual overviews and procedures, reading and writing example code, or updating help center queries and FAQs. Technical writers play a big part at Google. They are a key link between engineers, marketing associates, developer advocates, as well as all the external users and developers, tying together many vital but disparate parts of the Google ecosystem.

Using your extensive technical and leadership experience, you manage a team of writers, setting direction, giving feedback, collaborating internally and lending specific content expertise.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

  • Experience developing/launching products/technologies within one or more of the following: Cloud, SaaS, enterprise, internal tools, and/or complex supply chain networks.
  • Experience driving product vision, go-to-market strategy, and design discussions.
  • Experience creating strategic product roadmaps, working with cross-functional teams.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. The Program Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. In this role you'll bridge the technical and business worlds helping to deliver products that our customers love. You'll work with Googlers from Engineering, Sales, Marketing, Finance and other teams. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. In this role you'll help execute on our plans, as our challenge is not just solving problems in the way they’ve always been solved, rather to apply a heaping dose of Google ingenuity.

Users come first at Google. Nowhere is this more important than on our Advertising and Commerce team: we believe that ads and commercial information can be highly useful to our users if that information is relevant to what our users wish to find or do. Advertisers worldwide use Google Ads to promote their products; publishers use AdSense to serve relevant ads on their website; and business around the world use our products (like Google Shopping, and Google Wallet) to support their online businesses and bring users into their offline stores. We are constantly innovating to deliver the most effective advertising and commerce opportunities of tomorrow.
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in financial system program management.
  • Experience with B2B and/or B2C business monetization, agreements related accounting and intercompany/entity assignment logic, and/or month close related processes.

description:
Our roles often include components of strategy (e.g. analyzing and understanding new trends in the industry, building business plans), operations (e.g. running the cadence of organizations, connecting the operating lines between our functions), and communications. Our team partners with senior leadership to run important functions that cross-cut our existing organizations and deliver high impact projects. We help Engineers, PMs, UX, and all of our other functions to build amazing products that delight our users, and then get those products into their hands.

You develop strategies for Payments, in close partnership with product and function leads. You will play a central role supporting business models and business growth generation for Google Payments, both globally and locally. You take a highly strategic and analytical approach to your solutions. You are comfortable with quantitative pricing and economic analytics. You have innovative business thinking, strong communication and influencing skills, an ability to collaborate across teams and geographies, and a high degree of pragmatism and decision orientation.

Product and Business Strategy Leaders bring together teams across Google’s functions to help products execute optimally. Our team pushes Google to scale at key points that refine our products and infrastructure by executing efficiently, bringing solid business sense and sound judgment, and working effectively across organizational lines.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of relevant work experience.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

Google Cloud helps employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. As a Google Cloud Group Product Manager, you will help us deliver innovative cloud services at scale. You'll drive product strategy and partner closely with cross-functional teams to define and deliver on the next phase of cloud services. Additionally, you will develop product solutions, Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A), go-to-market, and business relationships to execute on the market potential and benefits possible from applying Google’s technologies in the enterprise market.

By applying to this role, you'll be considered for all teams working on Enterprise, including Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Developer Product Group, Internal Tools.

Google aims to build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. As a Product Manager at Google, you could be working on new technologies, platforms, consumer facing products, and/or enterprise systems. The end goal will be to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, experience, and where you will have the most impact.

description:
Google's metrics collection system powers monitoring for all of its services. It operates at unprecedented scale, accounting for a significant percentage of the internal infrastructure fleet.

We’re looking for an Engineering Director to lead taking this system through its next phase of growth, including scaling with Cloud, adding sophisticated query capabilities, and pursuing new opportunities such as IoT and integration with other data platforms, all while improving our reliability and scalability fundamentals.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

description:
Google builds products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether they’re down the street or across the globe.

As a Technical Program Manager focused on Security, you’ll use your technical expertise to protect corporate, user, and cloud data from attacks. You’ll protect network boundaries, ensure Googlers write secure code, keep computer systems and network devices hardened against attacks, and lead efforts to protect passwords, customer data, and other highly sensitive information. You will also work with software security engineers to proactively find and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.

In this role, you’ll plan requirements, identify risks, manage schedules, and communicate clearly with project stakeholders. And, thanks to Google’s industry leading benefits and ample opportunities for personal and professional development, you’ll learn and grow alongside talented teammates who share your attention to detail and appetite for problem-solving.

description:
The Insights, Infrastructure, and Technology (IIT) team focuses on the business of YouTube, ensuring the YouTube business organization can evolve at the speed of YouTube. We provide the tools and systems that deliver the information, capabilities, and insights necessary to help our partners — and YouTube — continue to grow.

As a product lead on the Content Partnerships Systems team within Business Technology at YouTube, you'll manage the capabilities of our core systems that support YouTube’s business organization. You will work with Business Technology Engineering teams to define and realize a vision for internal tools and systems that will empower content partnerships teams to drive and measure impact to YouTube partners, helping creators, artists, and media companies to reach their full potential with audiences around the world.

In this role, you'll wear many hats, from defining product requirements to partnering with our Engineering teams on systems design to launching and landing new and improved capabilities for our users. This will include evaluating and documenting needs, scoping technical solutions, identifying risks, and clearly communicating goals and milestones to business stakeholders globally.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

description:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

As Associate Corporate Counsel, you will work on a collegial team within a fast-paced legal department. You will support a variety of Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) and investment transactions, managing key aspects of due diligence, drafting and integration. You will contribute to a constantly evolving business.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
job_title: Associate Corporate Counsel, Mergers and Acquisitions

description:
As a Policy Specialist, you will be working with the Trademark and Counterfeit Operations team, which fields trademark and counterfeit complaints related to a variety of Google products, including (but not limited to) Google Ads, Google Shopping, and Google Play. You will review and process these complaints, with a high degree of accuracy and efficiency. In this role, you will be comfortable working independently. You will review trademark registrations and conduct an analysis/investigation of trademark descriptiveness, use, and ownership. You will also respond to internal and external inquiries regarding the trademark/counterfeit policies and processes.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

  • Ability to speak and write in English and Italian, French, or German fluently and idiomatically.

description:
Google Health is expanding its deployment capabilities in order to better serve our partners and customers. This team will be responsible for supporting all our partner deployments across the US, blending technical experts with program managers and clinical implementation specialists. We are looking for a Deployment Lead to oversee a team of partner engineers responsible for integrating Google technologies with our partners’ systems. The Deployment Lead will have accountability for developing deployment and integration plans that enable our product objectives. You will be an accomplished people manager, with experience of managing several complex programs simultaneously, working across geographies. You will get energy and satisfaction from developing and coaching less experienced team members. You will also be the key counterpart for partner CIOs or equivalents and responsible for managing relationships with our partners’ IT/digital teams.

Google has been exploring applications in health for more than a decade. This work has already made a significant contribution to health research and patient care. The newly formed Google Health product area includes experts from across Google who are leveraging expertise in AI, hardware, products and more in order to help people lead healthier lives.
summary:
• Experience in digital deployments in healthcare, as well as expert knowledge of US health systems and healthcare IT.
  • Experience operating at a management level.
  • Experience of integrating with Cloud tools and environments.
  • Experience in deploying products and services that conform to standards of safety, privacy and regulatory requirements, including HIPAA.

description:
You will drive measurement, analysis, and testing initiatives supporting global and regional marketing programs. You will directly analyze large data sets, and design and perform statistical analyses that continuously improve our process efficiency and campaign impact. In collaboration with a multidisciplinary team of marketing, product management, analytics and engineers, you will tap into the underlying data, align on key metrics/methodologies and generate insights that enable marketers to develop valuable, highly effective programs.

As a Global Analytics Lead you will play a strategic and technical role in driving all things media, marketing, analytics, and partnering with internal teams to evaluate strategic initiatives. You will own the end-to-end program management and delivery of key analytics and optimization initiatives while partnering with business leads across the organization to identify opportunities to optimize performance. This role will maintain a global scope, you will work with business and product teams across all operating regions and marketing entities.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

description:
Our team includes experts who are leveraging expertise in AI, hardware, products, and more to solve the big challenges in healthcare to help people lead healthier, more productive lives. This team works closely with other groups within Google and across Alphabet.

As a Regulatory Affairs Manager you will serve as a primary interface to regulatory authorities around the globe. In this role, you will regularly communicate with Competent Authorities and other regulatory bodies, support the Health PA teams in correct interpretation of regulation and guidance, develop pre and post market regulatory strategies, and prepare / manage regulatory submissions. You will work closely between Clinical, Regulatory, Research, Partners, Engineering and Legal Teams to lead proactively on all matters for Regulatory Affairs. As one of the most regulated industries, navigating international rules that govern Medical Devices is complex and challenging. Our team is working to deliver regulatory science solutions that ensure that Google Health’s innovative products reach our customers quickly and with the highest levels of quality and compliance.

At Google we’re committed to improving the lives of as many people as possible. One of the most important areas in which we’re striving to do that is health. Today we’re studying the use of artificial intelligence to assist in diagnosing cancer, predicting patient outcomes, preventing blindness, and much more. We’re exploring ways to improve patient care, including tools that are already being used by clinicians. And we’re partnering with doctors, nurses, and other healthcare professionals to help improve the care patients receive.
summary:
• 7 years of experience leading global regulatory affairs guidance for software-based in medical devices.
  • 3 years of experience providing regulatory advice to teams conducting clinical evaluations.
  • Experience with compliance requirements for US FDA, MDD/MDR, MEDDEV and Harmonized Standards.
  • Experience with approval submissions, clinical studies, labelling, pre-market communication, field actions, and QMS compliance.

description:
Core Developer brings a focused set of tooling and services to Google developers and beyond, enabling to them to develop and innovate quickly and conveniently. Our suite of solutions are used everyday by over 50,000 Googlers and vary from framework like Boq web and Flutter, to languages like C++ and Dart, as well as services like Boq and Tap. We are hyper-focused on making these tools better for our customers needs.

As the Chief of Staff for Core Developer Foundations, you will partner with our Foundation leader to establish operational excellence and scale for our new Core Developer organization. With large and far reaching impact, you will need both strategy and operations expertise to unlock the power of the 800+ Software Engineers in the Core Developer org and the 50,000+ Developers across Google. You will work closely with senior executives and their management team to efficiently run their business. You will manage the business cadence (communications, projects, planning, coordination) and strategic projects, provide a proxy for their leader, and communicate strategy and decision-making to the management team and other key stakeholders.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
job_title: Chief of Staff, Core Developer Foundations

In this role, you will contribute a diverse set of skills and experiences, ranging from a software engineering and product development background, to the ability to drive large-scale business transformations. Finally, you will demonstrate passion for identifying technical solutions for business problems and experience delivering innovative systems, rooted in user experience research and engineering excellence.

Google Cloud is widely recognized as a global leader in delivering a secure, open, and intelligent enterprise cloud platform. Today, customers across more than 150 countries trust Google Cloud to modernize their computing environment for today’s digital world. We are helping thousands of organizations, including many of the world’s largest companies, transform their businesses.

description:
As a User Experience (UX) leader, you help define and drive the future of Google design. You identify and set product strategy, envision complex UX ecosystems and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible. You possess a clear vision of the future of user experience and have the courage to pursue forward-thinking design.

In this role, you will apply your passion for brand, craft, and design fidelity to guide research and design processes, mentor talented members of your team, and collaborate with leaders of other UX and Engineering teams to create innovative experiences across all of Google’s products.

You will love using data and quantitative analysis to shape product development and influence overall strategy. Most importantly, we are looking for someone who is excellent at communicating and partnering closely with senior stakeholders and the leadership team in Google Maps.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

description:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. As part of our Global Performance Solutions team, you will focus on developing a deep understanding of market/user needs in performance media, and partnering across Product, Marketing, Sales, UX, and other functions to ensure our tools within Google Ads support critical
performance advertising use cases. You'll have experience planning, managing, and measuring performance media campaigns, excellent project management skills, and a track record of cross-functional collaboration.

In this role, you'll understand how our advertiser tools and features are being used globally, and what capabilities are needed to meet customer needs. You'll use insights to partner with Product Managers/Engineers to define solutions and influence the roadmaps and feature launches for your assigned products. In this role, you'll be the sole business owner of your assigned products. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities will shape how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you'll provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis.

Global Solutions is the link between Google products and business. Your focus is to help turn innovation into complete, packaged tools that allow our customers to get the most that they need from our products. As part of the Global Solutions team, you'll help to ensure that Google has adopted the right strategy for our products. Working in one of three specialized areas – Performance, Brand, or Publisher & Platform – you'll use your expertise to help front-line Sales partners to work their magic quickly and effectively. You are passionate about all things digital, and want to help shape the world of online advertising.
