description:
At gTech’s Users and Products team (gUP), we represent the voice of Google's users and many of our partners globally. The Payments team helps make payments fast, easy, and safe around the world. We create and manage Google’s global billing and payments platform, consumer applications, and merchant services.

As the Director - Payments, Client Success, you will set the payment platform’s client success strategy for Google’s products (e.g., Play, YouTube, Cloud, Hardware, Ads). You will lead an organization that leverages the Google payment platform stack to design business solutions based on a deep understanding of the business needs of Google’s largest products. With your business judgment and extensive product knowledge, you'll lead engagements between high priority clients and Google’s Payments product and Engineering teams. You'll be a trusted advisor with a deep understanding of the clients’ business needs, monetization strategy, product roadmap, and priorities. Your consultative services will combine deep technical and payment expertise with a powerful understanding of these clients’ needs to help them meet their business goals and drive growth for Google.

In this role, you'll influence product strategy, prioritize projects and resources, and lead cross-functional projects and business reviews for executive stakeholders. You'll keep the big picture in focus while diving into the engineering and business challenges of your clients. Additionally, you will provide hands-on leadership that is based on a model of trust and inclusiveness. Finally, you'll be a thought leader, working strategically with executives across the Payments, Business Development, Finance, and Operations teams to deliver on the business strategy.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
job_title: Director, Payments, Client Success, Payments Users and Products

description:
Think with Google is a global multi-disciplinary team of data scientists, designers, writers, marketers, researchers and engineers working within Google Marketing tasked with shaping and delivering—seamlessly and in real-time—the consumer, industry, and marketing trends and insights that our advertising customers need to grow their business. Through our websites, products, and growth marketing programs, we engage millions of marketers around the world, and share real-time insights, research, data, and trends from Google.

As a Product Growth Analyst, you’ll be responsible for our global analytics to measure impact of our programs around the world, and generate insights to influence important business and product decisions. Partnering with growth, engineering, and editorial teams, you will provide the analysis, insights, and recommendations to improve our user experience and content, and grow monthly active users (MAUs) and engagement rates.

Regressions, logical structuring, and modeling are some of the skills required for leveraging data from internal data stores and Google Analytics. In this role, you will develop hypotheses, run multivariate tests, and influence decisions of different functions on the team. These key data insights are critical to defining how we grow usage of our products.

As a Product Growth Analyst, you will be an independent, solution-oriented thinker with a background in processing huge data sets, applying analytical rigor and statistical methods, and driving toward insights and solutions. You will be a well-rounded top performer able to crunch the numbers one minute and critically think through strategic implications the next.

description:
Google's infrastructure needs go far beyond server computers. As Google's products and services scale the globe, the Strategic Negotiation team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Google's future -- everything from underwater cables to physical data center space. As a Strategic Negotiator, you combine your deep market knowledge of a given sector with tech industry savvy to negotiate cost-effective solutions to support Google's infrastructure growth. You'll work with specific project teams on negotiating deals, managing vendor and partner relationships and presenting deal recommendations to our Tech leadership. Your successful negotiations have the potential to save Google millions of dollars in operating costs and impact every part of the business.

As the Global Head of Data Center Economic and Community Development, you'll lead efforts to advocate in support of our data center fleet globally. This includes overseeing the portfolio of economic development incentives, leading our economic development program, managing local relationships, and leading efforts to develop data and content to better tell our story. You'll partner with site Portfolio Managers, Tax, Legal, and Government Affairs teams to lead the growth and management of our data center fleet. You will be responsible for building and maintaining an integrated strategy that spots issues and opportunities and grows this organization to meet the future needs of both internal and external stakeholders.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:
The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facilities Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some of these duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.

As an advocate for best practices, you develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly. In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

description:

As part of the Product Management team, you work closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. You connect the technical and with the business, working with teams across Engineering, Sales, Marketing and Finance. It also gives users extra benefits and allows them to share their membership with their family. As a Product Manager within Google One, you will helps us build a brand new business and shape future customer experiences. You’ll engage in business and technical problems, collaborating with a wide variety of partners to define the user experience, solution capabilities, and operational processes and deliver amazingly great experiences for users worldwide.

description:
Please contact the Recruiter to learn more about the role's timeline and process.

As Director Google Data Centers Business Systems, you'll be a global thought leader enabling business systems and transforming software solutions for data center delivery, equipment supply chain, and operations management. In this role, you'll drive alignment between business objectives and technical solutions as well as a vision, strategy, and execution for implementing and managing a connected ecosystem of technology solutions to support the data center organization’s automation needs. In this role, you'll leverage subject matter expertise in supply chain, asset management, construction project management, data management, analytics, including deep systems/modules knowledge. You will lead transformational, high-impact business systems initiatives and develop business systems architecture and implementation of solutions. Finally, you’ll contribute leadership experience in ERP implementations, supply chain systems implementations, and other large-scale system solutions.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

description:
Commodity Managers work with Engineering teams to make sure Google has the supplies and equipment to put into production the innovative products coming from our Engineering teams. As a Commodity Manager, you use your wide industry knowledge and strategic supplier relationships to optimize our total cost of ownership for our global -- and growing -- infrastructure. The scale at which Google operates means that savings on just one piece of hardware can have a huge impact on Google's bottom line.

The EDA Commodity Manager for Google will serve as the primary contact for internal teams and external partners/suppliers for strategic sourcing of EDA CAD/software tools, and emulation hardware. You will build consensus across internal and external stakeholders and will manage the relationship across the company. Additionally, you'll lead and support the development, implementation, and management of global strategies to ensure optimal pricing, flexibility, and quality. This includes full management of contract negotiations. You will also closely engage with our ASIC Engineering, Finance, and Legal Teams and centers around developing and executing on a long-term strategic roadmap.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. description:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

description:
Google is part of everyday life for billions of people. We trust Google to give us everything from advice to directions. Google is also one of the first places we go to shop. We rely on Google to help us compare options, find what we’re looking for, and discover new things. Google makes it easy to find the best deal and be smart shoppers. At Google, we also want to transform shopping into something magical. We believe in making shopping simple, personal, delightful, and fun.

At the heart of this transformation is user experience. Our UX team includes designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who share a passion for creating innovative and elegant products that people love. We build experiences that solve real pain points and meet fundamental user needs. Our work is grounded in a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: Focus on the user and all else will follow.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.

The Product Readiness Group is responsible for establishing and executing the Hardware Planning and Fulfillment Plan-of-Record for all Google Hardware NPI programs flowing through our global supply chain. The team's goal is to ensure each project is executed in an efficient and standardized approach following our phase/gate Product Development Processes, in order to meet our cost, milestone, and quality goals.

description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

As a product marketer, you'll help small businesses succeed with Google Ads. In this role, you will be responsible for driving growth for small businesses by leading marketing for Smart campaigns. Smart campaign is a revolutionary new automated campaign type. It is designed to make it easier than ever for small businesses to connect with their potential customers using Google Ads. Smart campaigns bring together Google’s expertise in ads and machine learning, helping small- and medium-sized businesses drive results and save time. Smart campaigns has ambitious growth goals for active users. You’ll have the exciting opportunity to lead the marketing efforts, working closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Sales and other teams.

Our team brings different teams together to create a delightful experience for customers across Smart campaigns and Google Ads.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

description:
Product and Business Strategy Leaders bring together teams across Google’s functions to help products execute optimally. Our team pushes Google to scale at key points that refine our products and infrastructure by executing efficiently, bringing solid business sense and sound judgment, and working effectively across organizational lines.

Our roles often include components of strategy (e.g. analyzing and understanding new trends in the industry, building business plans), operations (e.g. running the cadence of organizations, connecting the operating lines between our functions), and communications. Our team partners with senior leadership to run important functions that cross-cut our existing organizations and deliver high impact projects. We help Engineers, PMs, UX, and all of our other functions to build amazing products that delight our users, and then get those products into their hands.

On the Product Strategy and Business Operations team, you will work closely with product management and engineering leadership to define and build metrics, scope and conduct complex analyses, generate and communicate insights, and make recommendations to Product and Engineering leadership. As a Lead in the Cloud Services Platform Product Area, you'll have the opportunity to make an impact and drive initiatives. You'll discover, ideate, and pursue key projects that will drive understanding for the Product and Engineering teams. Your independent thinking and data creativity will be essential for this role.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

description:
As a User Experience (UX) leader, you help define and drive the future of Google design. You identify and set product strategy, envision complex UX ecosystems and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible. You possess a clear vision of the future of user experience and have the courage to pursue forward-thinking design.

In this role, you will apply your passion for brand, craft, and design fidelity to guide research and design processes, mentor talented members of your team, and collaborate with leaders of other UX and Engineering teams to create innovative experiences across all of Google’s products.

description:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

Google Cloud helps employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

description:
At Google, Visual Designers weave iconography, typography, color, space and texture together to help our users successfully navigate our products. We believe that all of our products should be beautiful and accessible. As a Visual Designer, you’ll delight users with designs that inspire, engage and excite them. You’ll rely on user-centered design principles to produce high-quality visuals—from concept to execution—across many platforms. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your fellow designers to constantly refine the Google design language and create innovative, great-looking products that people love to use.

Our team is interested in our users and strives to learn everything we can about their behaviors, attitudes and emotions to help define the products and experiences we create. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering these insights and then using them to inspire and inform design. We are a multi-disciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, user researchers, content strategists and web developers who collaborate closely with each other and with Engineering and Product Management to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. As the Head of UX for News, you will not just think about how we optimize the content we have today, but also work with publishers to influence an entire industry to create better storytelling tools for the future.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

With the Google Fiber Test Engineering team, you’ll work closely with cross-functional team members to refine development projects in support of Google Fiber Systems & Tools, Networking and Labs. A unique opportunity to be impactful while simultaneously executing complex projects that deliver high-speed access services across North America. Network infrastructure planning and acquisition is a critical element in the future of Google Fiber. As part of the GNA-AMER (SVL) team, leverage Google's massive network infrastructure investment and vendor relationships in support Google Fiber's evolving metro and long haul requirements. You will be responsible for working with SW Test and development teams to develop and deploy state of the art systems for our infrastructure.

“My internet is too fast!” ...said no one, ever. Google Fiber’s mission is to deliver abundant, reliable internet on networks that are always fast and open. On our team, you’ll work in a fast-paced environment that’s challenging the status quo in the broadband industry.
job_title: Technical Program Manager, Test, Google Fiber
summary:
• Bachelor's degree, other business relevant qualification or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of experience managing technical projects and working cross functionally with software engineering teams, business owners, and product managers.
  • Experience designing process improvements

description:
At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust and Safety (T&S) is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

The Google Play and Android team within T&S broadly provides business-critical content policy enforcement, partner support, and content ingestion to facilitate, review, and handle the (ever-growing) digital content catalog of Google Play. The Content Operations team is looking for a high-performing individual motivated by taking operations to the next level in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You will design, run and continually improve processes to deliver operational excellence and support the rapidly-expanding Google Play Apps and Games business. Focus areas include: launch readiness management, stakeholder management, operational program management, and process excellence.

Google Play offers music, movies, books, apps and games for devices, powered by the cloud. It syncs across devices and on the web. As part of the Android and Mobile team, Googlers working on Google Play do everything from engineering our backend systems, to shaping product strategy, to forming great content partnerships. They make it possible for people to do things like buy an ebook or song on their Android phone, then have it instantly available on their laptop. The Google Play team enhances the Android ecosystem by giving developers and partners a premium store where they can reach millions of users.
job_title: Operations Program Manager, Trust and Safety, Google Play
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Operations, related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience working with cross-functional teams, such as Product, Legal and Engineering.
  • Ability to travel internationally 25% of the time. Ability to work nonstandard work hours as needed.

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Google builds products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether they’re down the street or across the globe.

As a lead on our team, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead teams focused on complex, multi-disciplinary projects with Google-sized impact.

In this role, your team will plan requirements, identify risks, manage schedules, and communicate clearly with project stakeholders. And, thanks to Google’s industry leading benefits and ample opportunities for personal and professional development, you’ll learn and grow alongside talented teammates who share your attention to detail and appetite for problem-solving.

description:
As the Director of the Web Team for Google Cloud, you are a leader with passion and a proven track record of developing highly performing web properties. You are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of how Google Cloud leverages digital customer experiences across the user journey. You will ensure every Google Cloud customer and prospect has an effective and compelling online experience. You are accountable for demand generation and awareness through online channels and are the lead across Google Cloud in ensuring that the cloud.google.com and gsuite.google.com websites drive desired outcomes.

As a data-driven leader, you are an expert at developing customer insights, getting input from stakeholders (sales, product, services), and understanding performance and results, and translating that into innovative strategies that drive outsized impact. You have excellent collaboration and influencing skills that enable you to work effectively cross-functionally across sales, product, brand, legal, as well as the regional marketing and operations teams.

The Google Cloud Web team is responsible for managing the end-to-end inbound customer journey, from SEO, to SEM landings to content, conversion optimization, creative, acquisition programs, web analytics, and more - this team makes finding, understanding, loving, trying, buying, and growing with Google Cloud as easy as possible.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
job_title: Director of Web Team, Google Cloud Marketing

• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience in B2B marketing.
  • 5 years of experience in leading web site teams and digital marketing efforts.

description:
Google's infrastructure needs go far beyond server computers. As Google's products and services scale the globe, the Strategic Negotiation team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Google's future -- everything from underwater cables to physical data center space. As a Strategic Negotiator, you combine your deep market knowledge of a given sector with tech industry savvy to negotiate cost-effective solutions to support Google's infrastructure growth. You'll work with specific project teams on negotiating deals, managing vendor and partner relationships and presenting deal recommendations to our Tech leadership. Your successful negotiations have the potential to save Google millions of dollars in operating costs and impact every part of the business.

As a Data Center Acquisitions Strategic Negotiator, you will have a key role in helping to drive the team's overall location strategy, site selection, and portfolio management for Google’s owned and leased data center sites and related infrastructure. In particular, you will focus on forging new frameworks and providing the analytical support for Google’s global data center acquisition and site selection work.

In this role, you will work successfully across diverse circumstances, expectations, environments, cultures, paradigms and technologies. You are adept at strategizing, structuring, and analyzing a range of mission-critical transactions in diverse settings and with diverse parties, and will work on initiatives large and small, with only the support of small, focused teams. Additionally, you will plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks, and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:
As a Product Manager for Android games and graphics, you will help game developers get the most out of Android’s operating system as a game platform, and deliver a display stack that provides a smooth experience for all apps and games for all form factors.

You’ll own the all-up strategy for graphics and game technologies in the Android operating system and ecosystem. Critical to the role is executing a strategy and roadmap that encourages OEMs/SOCs to adopt our stack and deliver competitive game experiences on Android. You’ll work with a talented cross-functional group of product managers, software engineers, designers, business development and developer advocates to understand and manage the nuances of this large mobile game ecosystem.

Our game initiatives have a material impact on top game companies around the world, and create opportunity for developers creating novel and groundbreaking mobile video games. You will shape the success of the video game industry as device and chipset manufacturing and game making become ever more complex to meet the evolving tastes of game players worldwide.

Google aims to build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. As a Product Manager at Google, you could be working on new technologies, platforms, consumer facing products, and/or enterprise systems. The end goal will be to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, experience, and where you will have the most impact.

The Facilities Management team brings our spaces to life as you oversee the daily operations of our offices. While roles with similar names at other companies can be far more mundane, you're a creative, organized customer service specialist, who takes pride in seeing things run smoothly and efficiently. You go out of your way to make sure that clients are not only satisfied, but singing Google's praises. You're comfortable in a fast-paced environment with the highest standards of excellence. You aren't afraid to have fun with your job, and bring an enthusiasm, dedication and a collaborative spirit to build and maintain office spaces that facilitate some of the world's most cutting edge innovation.

description:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. As part of the Finance Data and Analytics (DnA) team, you will use data to inform business and product decisions across Google. In this role, you will have the opportunity to incubate data solutions at scale at Google’s first Finance Center of Excellence by partnering with  teams across different verticals to drive process efficiency and performance management insights to key stakeholders.

Nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generate management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll contribute technical skills, business judgment, and creativity to build automated data solutions that provide strategic insights. You'll take initiative and work well in environments with multiple cross-functional stakeholders and differing priorities. Additionally, you'll contribute people skills and drive to provide training and support to team members and partners.  You'll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects using your data warehousing and analytics expertise, manage project schedules, identifying risks, and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

description:
Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Business Analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.

Leaders in Data Science can see different angles of a product or business opportunity, and you know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. You have substantial experience with analytical tools and techniques, and bring a solid skill-set in analyzing data and communicating recommendations. You will deepen your skill-set by working with analytical thought leaders across the company.

Data Scientists are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Experimentation is at the core of what you do. In this role, you will work to effectively turn business questions into data analysis, and provide meaningful recommendations on strategy. This is a unique hybrid role that will focus on your knowledge of data infrastructure and your ability to drive insights.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

We are a fun and passionate team building the next generation of computing. As a Product Manager, you will help us shape the future of computing and make it accessible to everyone. The Chrome OS team delivers amazing experiences for all kinds of form factors, and our journey has just begun.

In this role, you will, lead our next generation of security features and guide our product strategy while executing on the finer details. You will demonstrate and understanding of operating systems and a passion for protecting our users. You will also collaborate with a talented team of security engineers and Product and Kernel teams to build a secure platform at scale.

Google aims to build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. As a Product Manager at Google, you could be working on new technologies, platforms, consumer facing products, and/or enterprise systems. The end goal will be to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, experience, and where you will have the most impact.
job_title: Lead Product Manager, Chrome OS Platform, Security
summary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of technical product Management experience (i.e. creating strategic product roadmap(s) from conception to launch and working with cross-functional teams).
  • Experience working in a security and/or privacy team on data protection, user trust, and risk analysis.
  • Experience in software system architecture.

description:
The biggest shift for Google Lens over the next 3 years will be enabling low-latency, reliable results using emerging capabilities in computer vision, on-device recognition and object detection. These capabilities will further extend into AR capabilities that are powered by AR-Core that scales to >1B devices today. The entire Lens and AR experience relies on a strong set of platforms to deliver these products to users.

We are looking for a strong technical lead with the necessary background and experience to drive these AR platforms strategy forward. You will lead the combined ARCore and Lens platforms teams in building out the necessary infrastructure to power Lens and AR experiences. In addition, you will be directly responsible for driving critical latency improvement programs for Lens.

You will also lead engagements with cross-functional partners to drive cross-platform Lens initiatives. You will lead these engagements and manage the end-2-end execution in partnership with Business Development, Engineering, Marketing, UX, Legal and Program Management teams.

The Google Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.
job_title: Lead Technical Program Manager, AR Platforms
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, related engineering field, or equivalent practical experience
  • 15 years of experience in program management
  • 5 years of people management experience
  • 5 years of release management experience

description:
The Developer Relations organization helps keep us connected to the communities that love technology as much as we do. Our focus is on supporting third party developers who build applications and businesses on Google's platforms. Developer Advocates act as passionate advocates for Google technologies, and are vocal advocates for developer interests within Google. This is a position for engineers who love connecting with developers and speaking publicly about cutting-edge technologies on conference panels, at user groups, on blogs and with the press. You also communicate internally with Product Managers. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5, as well as our core G Suite and Ads APIs, are just some of the platforms you promote and support. Your work fosters a community of developers working with Google technologies and helps to drive strategy around Developer Relations.

Dart and Flutter DevRel is the external face of Flutter and the internal face of the developer. We educate the community, helping them build the best Flutter apps they can, ensure that they have a wonderful experience while doing so, and bring feedback to the engineering team for future development.
job_title: Head of Dart and Flutter, Developer Relations
summary:
• 6 years of experience working in a consultant capacity helping fellow developers.
  • 4 years of experience managing interdisciplinary teams.

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Key Account Director/rExecutive, you will serve as the senior executive selling to the most strategic enterprises. You will leverage existing relationships with CEOs and C-level executives, developing new relationships with business unit leaders to understand their unique company challenges and to influence their perspective of Google solutions. You will do this with deep industry understanding, communicating the business value of One Google while driving shareholder value. In this role, you will wield the innovative power of our products and solutions to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile. There may be opportunity for this position to be based in other locations.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers & developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

description:
Google's infrastructure needs go far beyond server racks. As Google's products and services scale to serve billions, the Strategic Negotiation team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Google's future. As a Strategic Negotiator, you combine your deep market knowledge with tech industry savvy to negotiate cost-effective solutions to support Google's growth. You'll work with specific project teams on negotiating agreements, managing vendor and partner relationships and presenting agreement recommendations to our leadership. Your successful negotiations have the potential to impact every part of the business and save Google millions of dollars in operating costs. You'll manage a team who negotiates significant agreements to ensure Google receives contract compliance and cost-effective solutions. You'll lead project teams on special agreements, manage vendor relationships and present agreement recommendations to Google leadership.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:

You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Google's infrastructure needs go far beyond server computers. The Data Center Energy and Location Strategy team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Google's future. As a Program Manager for Data Center Supply Planning, you'll work closely with our internal demand forecasting teams, data center construction teams, and data center site selection teams, among others, to lead cross-functional initiatives to support planning for Google's land and infrastructure growth. You'll also work broadly across the Data Center Energy and Location Strategy team to plan requirements, identify risks, and communicate findings to internal stakeholders.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. description:
Commodity Managers work with Engineering teams to make sure Google has the supplies and equipment to put into production the innovative products coming from our Engineering teams. As a Commodity Manager, you use your wide industry knowledge and strategic supplier relationships to optimize our total cost of ownership for our global -- and growing -- infrastructure. The scale at which Google operates means that savings on just one piece of hardware can have a huge impact on Google's bottom line.

As the Global Commodity Manager, you will define and execute Google’s strategic sourcing of capital equipment, advance technologies and supplier management, primarily for our cloud infrastructure data centers. You will demonstrate extensive knowledge of technology management, strategy development, sourcing, fulfillment, supplier management, and cost management.

In this role, you will balance tactical and strategic issues concurrently, demonstrating excellent business judgment, program management fluency, and interpersonal communication, teamwork, conflict resolution, and relationship management skills. You will take a leadership in working with peers, managers, internal stakeholders, and executives of Google and Supplier Partners.

description:
We’re seeking an innovative, expansive thinker to provide both inspiration and organizational leadership and lead our design vision, strategy and implementation of an array of experiences across the Assistant portfolio of products, including: mobile (iOS+Android), Automotive, Wearables, TV, other home devices (Google Home, Smart Displays, etc) and more. A key area of responsibility is developing our team’s collective muscle for delivering high-fidelity, increasingly expressive designs across a growing ecosystem of surfaces and modalities. This role will report to the VP of User Experience and partner closely with the heads of PM and Engineering for the Assistant, in addition to UX leads for User Research, Creative and Engineering and Operations. You'll be responsible for driving a healthy, inclusive culture and orchestrating across a broad range of functions and features to produce nonpareil designs and ensure collaboration, transparency and clarity between multiple offices, teams and functions.

You're a diplomatic leader with a strong point of view, serving as a vanguard for expressive design and new standards. You have an uncanny sense for envisioning and driving high-order logistics that will help scale the team and function and promote a high bar for craft and quality across the organization. The role will significantly influence the experience and cultural norms of billions of global users so an unfailing passion and capacity to advocate on behalf of users is a must. Accordingly, it is critical that you have a prowess for empathetic, inclusive design that accounts for end-to-end user journeys which extend across a manifold of users, geographies, devices, products and services.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”
job_title: Senior Director of UX, Google Assistant
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Design, HCI, Interaction or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in C-level roles creating strategy and designing products.
  • Experience designing/developing for front-end mobile and web technologies. Experience working collaboratively with designers, product managers and engineers.
  • A portfolio demonstrating your work.

description:
As the Engineering Director, you will be leading all hardware and software platform development aspects of our products and solutions, including Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, low-level software for hardware bring-up, cross device software platform, development tools (for internal and external use), and direct partner/service teams like Industrial design, optics, display systems, manufacturing team, quality control, etc.

The Hardware Engineering team is not only responsible for designing, prototyping and validating the AR and VR devices but is also responsible for architecting and building a multi-generational Hardware Development platform that accelerates our internal development and enables collaboration with solution vendors and OEM partners.

The Software Platform team is responsible for the underlying wearable software platform that powers the team’s entire range of customer hardware products and enables a wide range of experiences and capabilities. This common software platform also brings the power of many other teams from across Google in the form of APIs and SDKs, adapted to the team’s unique needs.

In this role, you will lead and manage a large organization in Mountain View, CA.

The Google Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

The Cloud Business Systems team is responsible for building all of cloud business systems including Marketing, Sales, Finance, Customer Support, Partners, etc. As our Cloud teams grow rapidly, we need our business systems to support this massive growth. This team will have the opportunity to build innovative systems from the ground up that directly increase growth for Google Cloud.

description:

You'll work closely with partners and internal teams, understanding both Google's architecture and codebase as well as partner implementation details. You'll proactively identify gaps and potential issues, drive solutions, and then scale these solutions.

Whether working with next-gen chipset manufacturers or emerging market telcos, Google's Android Partner Engineering team helps solve some of the toughest mobile technology problems. We work with teams throughout Google to develop solutions for strategic partners around the globe. description:
Whether you’re guiding a user through a shift in context or expressing the personality of your brand, motion and animation are key ingredients to refine a user's experience on every screen— from mobile phones and tablets to desktops and beyond. At Google, we use motion design to help tell a product’s story, guide our users, improve usability and make the user’s experience responsive and fun. As a Motion Designer, it’s your job to apply your passion for animation to simplify complex interactions and solve challenging design problems.

In this role, you’ll help define and implement Google’s motion design language across all platforms—this includes driving the creation of best practices, collaborating with visual and interaction designers, and working with other product teams. You’ll think critically about how motion reinforces Google’s UX objectives, enhances interactivity, and delights our users.

The Android Handheld UX team designs the core experience of the Android OS on Pixel phones and a billion other devices. Our domain is everything you interact with on phones that’s not an app: home screens, global navigation, notifications, task-switching, device onboarding and settings, and much much more. As a Motion Designer you will help define what the future of smartphone experience should be.

You are a great design team leader, manager, systems-level design thinker, and visionary - with strong instincts and outstanding intuition - who will provide leadership and direction for a team of designers. Our ideal candidate has an uncanny sense for clean design, is a fierce advocate for the user, and is committed to creating elegantly simple user experiences from otherwise complex workflows. You also take the time to understand not just the execution side of design, but the business aspects of the products as well.

description:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.

Google Enterprise Network’s Engineering team architects and designs for internal IT network connectivity. The team works on projects across all levels of the technology stack and the focus is on introducing new hardware, software and cutting edge technology to a demanding set of users and environments spanning the globe.

In this role, you'll be involved in setting technical direction, building next generation architectures and designs for distributed services, engage in creating software abstractions and the components of the system that operates and powers Google and leading/managing people and their careers. The team solve challenging problems relating to scale, security and availability as Google continues to push the boundaries for innovative new technologies.

description:
Technical writers communicate complex information clearly, concisely and accurately, and without relying on jargon. As a technical writer, your role involves tasks such as writing conceptual overviews and procedures, reading and writing example code, or updating help center queries and FAQs. Technical writers play a big part at Google. They are a key link between engineers, marketing associates, developer advocates, as well as all the external users and developers, tying together many vital but disparate parts of the Google ecosystem.

As Lead Technical Writer for the Go Programming Language, you’ll be a key part of how we help Go developers deliver their applications to millions of consumers worldwide, and you’ll communicate with hundreds of thousands of developers through compelling conceptual documentation, detailed developer guides, code samples, API references, and other online materials.
job_title: Lead Technical Writer, Go Programming Language
locations: ['New York, NY, USA', 'Kirkland, WA, USA', 'Seattle, WA, USA']
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with source code in C, C++, or Go.
  • Experience in technical writing, product documentation, or online publishing including experience with writing technical customer-facing materials.

description: As a Program Manager for G Suite Communications and Google Cloud Platform incidents, you'll be a trust anchor for our customers. You will be part of a team of Engineers, Legal counsels and key partners in Search, Android, and Cloud (amongst others) focused on incident communication planning and execution while applying top operational excellence. You will shape the processes and tools required for effective communication management while maintaining a culture of trust, respect, and collaboration.

description:
Every day hundreds of millions of people across the world rely on Google Maps. Whether they are finding their way through a crowded city or driving on freeways with congested traffic. Geo’s mission is to assist people as they navigate, explore and get things done in the world. Google Maps plays a foundational role in accomplishing this mission and we’re just getting started.

In this role, you will lead the Google Maps Driving and Google Maps Automotive UX teams to design the best maps experience on devices and in cars, optimized for driving with intuitive functionality seamlessly integrated with the car's hardware. We are looking for an experienced UX Director to lead and grow our global UX team. You will advocate for and design holistic, end-to-end experiences for all users. You have proven design and facilitative leadership abilities and enjoy a mix of hands-on research, product strategy, team management, and bringing innovative products to market.

You will apply your passion for design, engineering, and the impossible to guide research and design processes, mentor talented members of your team, and collaborate with leaders within UX, Product and Engineering across all of Google’s products. You will identify and set platform strategy, envision complex user (driver, dealer, buyer, auto manufacturer, and third- party developer) interactions, and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible. You possess a clear vision of the future of UX, and have the courage to pursue forward-thinking design.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”
job_title: Director of UX, Driving and Maps Automotive
summary:
• Bachelor’s degree in Design, HCI, Interaction, a relevant industry, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience in a C-level role, creating strategy and designing products.
  • Experience in front-end mobile and web technologies.

description:
You will be responsible for all aspects of supplier development and ongoing performance management to Google's technology and business needs with a focus on NPI. You'll develop and execute Google's sourcing strategy for our Server and Storage system hardware, in support of our infrastructure deployment that powers all of Google's services. You will be expected to lead and participate on large projects, as well as understand and resolve complex issues that put company objectives at risk. You will be a key part of an end-to-end supply chain team that drives continuous improvement and ensures operational excellence in support of Google's rapid growth. You have technical knowledge, market knowledge, supply chain and people skills to work with engineering and suppliers to develop products You have worked with server and storage architectures and understand which ODMs and JDMs in the market are best suited for Google’s requirements. You will be responsible for selecting and managing the supply base (ODM, JDM) very early in product development. You will be expected to handle all contract negotiations during NPI and enable Google to deliver product in the best possible time-to-market and cost.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

The Global Data Center Security (GDCS) team is chartered with protecting the people and assets that operate and support Google's global critical infrastructure.

As a Program Manager on the GDCS Compliance, Auditing, and Policy (CAP) team, you will lead and drive the success of audits and compliance as related to Google Data Centers. In this team, you will be a thought leader who creates effective solutions by leveraging the expertise of a vast array of partners. In this role, you’ll cover a region of infrastructure spaces and interact closely with teams in GDC to ensure the successful delivery, execution and optimization of the audits and compliance program.

description:
Google's infrastructure needs go far beyond server computers. As Google's products and services scale the globe, the Strategic Negotiation team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Google's future -- everything from underwater cables to physical data center space. As a Strategic Negotiator, you combine your deep market knowledge of a given sector with tech industry savvy to negotiate cost-effective solutions to support Google's infrastructure growth. You'll work with specific project teams on negotiating deals, managing vendor and partner relationships and presenting deal recommendations to our Tech leadership. Your successful negotiations have the potential to save Google millions of dollars in operating costs and impact every part of the business.

As a Project Lead for Carbon-Free Energy, you'll help lead our efforts in creating and deploying new carbon-free energy initiatives. You'll have the opportunity to source and lead new energy projects across our global energy supply portfolio. You will initiate and lead discussions and collaborate with utilities and industry partners on specific initiatives aimed at decarbonizing Google and the grid, and develop projects. Your work will cover a wide range of types of projects, and you'll act as our technical lead when interfacing with external parties and work cross-functionally internally to coordinate our commercial and operations teams in order to initiate projects.

description:
As Privacy Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

Our Privacy legal team has multiple openings with different focus areas. We are targeting candidates with experience in one or more of the following areas:
1) Experience advising on compliance with global privacy regulations, including on health, payments, and/or children’s privacy-specific regulations;
2) Experience advising on responding to suspected data breaches;
3) Experience designing compliance programs, policies, and processes;
4) Experience counseling on privacy issues in advertising technology.
5) Experience counseling and negotiating data protection terms in enterprise agreements.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
locations: ['San Francisco, CA, USA', 'Mountain View, CA, USA']

• J.D. or equivalent degree.

  • Experience with global privacy laws, including extensive experience with European and U.S. law.
  • Admitted to the bar and in good standing or otherwise authorized to practice law (e.g., have registered in-house status) in the state in which the role is located.

description:
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in data analysis.
  • Experience in one or more of the following: coding, databases and querying, front-end development, or Statistical analysis (e.g., R, Stata, SPSS, SAS).
  • Experience relaying communications between technical and non-technical teams.

When it comes to understanding and promoting user trust, the T&S Research team is the ambassador for the world of users outside of Google; we listen and investigate to deliver actionable insights, and educate others on online safety. T&S is a platform team in Trust & Safety, supporting all products in Google through deep research skills and a user-first mentality. description:
At gTech’s Users and Products team (gUP), our mission is to help users get the most out of Google. We represent the voice of Google's users and many of our partners globally, sharing insights with the larger Google organization to enable exceptional customer and product experiences.

gUP builds innovative solutions that take user experience and engagement with Google to the next level, supporting users across products, countries, cultures, incomes, and identities. We advocate for users through partnerships with product areas at Google (and some Alphabet businesses), supporting Google’s consumer products ecosystem and enabling numerous launches for Google’s consumer products each year.

We are committed to building an ever more diverse, equitable, and inclusive gUP, and consider this the foundation upon which individual, team, and user success are built. We're also committed to innovation not only in the content of our work, but in the way we work. Check out this blog post on our Chameleon program.

As an Customer Success Engineer, you'll be responsible for the success of Google products on the Google payments platform. You will lead all engagements between these clients and Google’s Payments Product and Engineering teams. Your consultative services will combine deep technical and payment expertise with an understanding of these clients’ needs to help them meet their business goals and drive Google growth.

You will influence product strategy, prioritize projects and resources, lead cross-functional projects and business reviews for our stakeholders. You will oversee technical implementation services, and possess strong technical skills for troubleshooting integration issues.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

As a Technical Program Manager, you'll help lead our efforts in adopting new carbon free energy technologies to ensure Google’s data centers and operations operate on carbon-free energy. You will have the opportunity to source, evaluate, and select new carbon-free energy technology for Google’s data centers to adopt in our global portfolio of energy supply. You will lead the technology review, business case assessment, and deployment strategy in coordination with Engineering and Operations teams.

This is a dynamic role, working with a worldwide network of internal stakeholders as well as strategic partners to support the growth of carbon-free energy. You'll lead programmatic efforts across regions and various types of carbon-free energy technologies related to new types of power generation and energy storage.
